'Success' was an Australian prison ship, built in 1840. Between the 1890s and
the 1930s, she was converted into a floating museum displaying relics of the
convict era and purporting to represent the horrors of penal transportation in
Great Britain and the United States of America. After extensive world tours she
was destroyed by fire while berthed in Lake Erie near Cleveland, Ohio in 1946.
